channel.title: Equip item become Npc Animation problems

item.title: Equip item become Npc Animation problems
item.dc:creator: @Getstupid Getstupid
item.description:
@Getstupid wrote:

Chaotic-Scape:

It might be because its something bigger and something smaller. Like the animations are made for something smaller and your using something bigger. Unless it doesn’t turn you into an npc when its little also?

But I’m using the steel dragon with the Steel dragon’s animations…

xmonster:

why did you bump this :facepalm:

Lolwut? He’s just helping me out…

EDIT: For some reason when I spam click the ring the Animations work!?

item.title: Equip item become Npc Animation problems
item.dc:creator: @Getstupid Getstupid
item.description:
@Getstupid wrote:

Chaotic-Scape:

Do you have those type of animations? And other then those animations are the same as the eggs. I don’t know whats wrong.

I have the animations…

if (playerCommand.startsWith("cat") && c.playerRights >= 3) { int id = 3507; c.npcId2 = id; c.isNpc = true; c.updateRequired = true; c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true; c.playerStandIndex = 9158;//stand animation c.playerTurnIndex = 9158;//turn animation(usually walk) c.playerWalkIndex = 9157;//walk animation c.playerTurn180Index = 9158;//half turn animation(usually walk) c.playerTurn90CWIndex = 9158;//1\4 turn animation(usually walk) c.playerTurn90CCWIndex = 9157;//half turn animation(usually RUN) c.playerRunIndex = 9156;//change to the npc's run animation or use walk }
for example works PERFECTLY as a command as so does the dragon… Can’t figure out why the animations don’t work when I equip the ring =/

Read full topic

item.title: Equip item become Npc Animation problems
item.dc:creator: @Getstupid Getstupid
item.description:
@Getstupid wrote:

Chaotic-Scape:

Replace your code with that. And add the thing I told you in clickingbuttons.java, somewhere.

I LOVE YOU! thanks so much

one more thing if you can please
?
Would It be possible to add the animations so I could add an npc not just the egg?
I added c.updateRequired = true; c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true; c.playerStandIndex = 6496;//stand c.playerTurnIndex = 6496;//turn c.playerWalkIndex = 79;//walk c.playerTurn180Index = 6496;//half turn c.playerTurn90CWIndex = 6496;//1\4 turn c.playerTurn90CCWIndex = 79;//half turn run c.playerRunIndex = 79;//run animation
^for steel drag
But it’s not working for some reason
the dragon shows but the animations aren’t kicking in >_>

Read full topic

item.title: Equip item become Npc Animation problems
item.dc:creator: @Chaotic-Scape Chaotic-Scape
item.description:
@Chaotic-Scape wrote:

Thats too take the ring off :P. Eh, might as well give you the thing to put the easter ring on.

if(c.wearId == 7927) { c.setSidebarInterface(1, 6014); c.setSidebarInterface(2, 6014); c.setSidebarInterface(3, 6014); c.setSidebarInterface(4, 6014); c.setSidebarInterface(5, 6014); c.setSidebarInterface(6, 6014); c.setSidebarInterface(7, 6014); c.setSidebarInterface(8, 6014); c.setSidebarInterface(9, 6014); c.setSidebarInterface(10, 6014); c.setSidebarInterface(11, 6014); c.setSidebarInterface(12, 6014); c.setSidebarInterface(13, 6014); c.setSidebarInterface(0, 6014); c.sendMessage("As you put on the ring you turn into an egg!"); c.npcId2 = 3689 + Misc.random(5); c.isNpc = true; c.updateRequired = true; c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

Replace your code with that. And add the thing I told you in clickingbuttons.java, somewhere.

Read full topic
item.source: Equip item become Npc Animation problems

item.title: Equip item become Npc Animation problems
item.dc:creator: @Getstupid Getstupid
item.description:
@Getstupid wrote:

[quote=“Chaotic-Scape, post:2, topic:418352”]Are you trying to make it like the easter ring? And to make it so you can morph back you need to add something in clickingbuttons.java for example : (Easter ring unmorphing)

case 23132: c.setSidebarInterface(1, 3917); c.setSidebarInterface(2, 638); c.setSidebarInterface(3, 3213); c.setSidebarInterface(4, 1644); c.setSidebarInterface(5, 5608); c.setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); c.setSidebarInterface(7, 1); c.setSidebarInterface(8, 5065); c.setSidebarInterface(9, 5715); c.setSidebarInterface(10, 2449); c.setSidebarInterface(11, 904); c.setSidebarInterface(12, 147); c.setSidebarInterface(13, 962); c.setSidebarInterface(0, 2423); c.getItems().deleteEquipment(c.playerEquipment[c.playerRing], c.playerRing); c.getItems().addItem(7927,1); c.isNpc = false; c.updateRequired = true; c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true; break;[/quote]
Thanks for the response, but… It didn’t work.

Is there a way to do something like… If I’m wearing the ring… then activate a command.
like put on ring -> activates the command “easteregg”?.. ::easteregg

Read full topic
item.source: Equip item become Npc Animation problems

item.title: Equip item become Npc Animation problems
item.dc:creator: @Chaotic-Scape Chaotic-Scape
item.description:
@Chaotic-Scape wrote:

Are you trying to make it like the easter ring? And to make it so you can morph back you need to add something in clickingbuttons.java for example : (Easter ring unmorphing)

case 23132: c.setSidebarInterface(1, 3917); c.setSidebarInterface(2, 638); c.setSidebarInterface(3, 3213); c.setSidebarInterface(4, 1644); c.setSidebarInterface(5, 5608); c.setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); c.setSidebarInterface(7, 1); c.setSidebarInterface(8, 5065); c.setSidebarInterface(9, 5715); c.setSidebarInterface(10, 2449); c.setSidebarInterface(11, 904); c.setSidebarInterface(12, 147); c.setSidebarInterface(13, 962); c.setSidebarInterface(0, 2423); c.getItems().deleteEquipment(c.playerEquipment[c.playerRing], c.playerRing); c.getItems().addItem(7927,1); c.isNpc = false; c.updateRequired = true; c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true; break;

Read full topic

item.title: Equip item become Npc Animation problems
item.dc:creator: @Getstupid Getstupid
item.description:
@Getstupid wrote:

okeyz was making it so if you equipped the ring you would be the selected npc.

BUT it’s not picking up the animations?

if (wearID == 7927) { int id = 3590; c.npcId2 = id; c.isNpc = true; c.updateRequired = true; c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true; c.playerStandIndex = 6496; c.playerTurnIndex = 6496; c.playerWalkIndex = 79; c.playerTurn180Index = 6496; c.playerTurn90CWIndex = 6496; c.playerTurn90CCWIndex = 6496; c.playerRunIndex = 79;
no compile errors…

Also- How would I make it so that when I take off the ring/item my character is back to human again?
